messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Hunting in England?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Lucky we re leaving then...... Shyrley You laugh at me because I m different. I laugh at you because you are all the same.
messages.messageBody:

>
> In a message dated 9/30/02 12:14:10 PM, shyrley.williams@...
> writes:
>
> << Wonder where Charles will go if Fox hunting is banned? You lot are
> more than welcome to him and the whole royal family
> >>
>
> I'm sure they would live in Virginia!
> (booga booga!)
>
> Sandra
>
Lucky we're leaving then......

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Hunting in England?
messages.msgSnippet: ... People don t hunt like what they do here. The aristrocracy go on grouse shoots and pheasant shoots. Its all organised and is very expensive. The rcih also
messages.messageBody:
On 30 Sep 02, at 12:55, Dnowens@... wrote:



> People don't hunt in England? <eg> Didn't I see that Prince Charles
> would leave England if Fox hunting is banned? ;o) I could have sworn
> that we went pheasant and grouse hunting when I was a kid and we
> visited friends in England and Scotland. But we lived so many places,
> I could be wrong about the place. (?) ~Nancy
>
People don't hunt like what they do here. The aristrocracy go on
grouse shoots and pheasant shoots. Its all organised and is very
expensive. The rcih also go fox-hunting.
It's not like here where you can just take your gun and go shoot
something.
Actually I think some people go and kill rabbits for food but mainly
farmers.

Wonder where Charles will go if Fox hunting is banned? You lot are
more than welcome to him and the whole royal family

:-)

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Hunting in England?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/30/02 9:55:15 AM Central Daylight Time, ... People don t hunt in England?  Didn t I see that Prince Charles would leave England if Fox
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/30/02 9:55:15 AM Central Daylight Time,
shyrley.williams@... writes:


> Ah. Well we do a bit of that then. But only in the US cos people
> go out hunting and then the meat is free. Back home people don't
> hunt. I'm not sure if its cos its illegal, or wildlife is protected or that
>
> we ain't allowed guns. (I'm not counting the aristocracy chasing
> foxes. Thats not hunting, more like torture and slaughter).
>
> My dogs will eat everything except rice and potato peelings.
>
> Shyrley

People don't hunt in England? <eg> Didn't I see that Prince Charles would
leave England if Fox hunting is banned? ;o) I could have sworn that we went
pheasant and grouse hunting when I was a kid and we visited friends in
England and Scotland. But we lived so many places, I could be wrong about the
place. (?)
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
